chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall m n : Z, rel_prime m n -> rel_prime m (Z.sub (Z.mul m m) (Z.mul n n))

Premises:
N.sub = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos n' => match m with | 0%N => n | N.pos m' => match Pos.sub_mask n' m' with | Pos.IsPos p => N.pos p | _ => 0%N end end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.sub (_ _)%N_scope
rel_prime = fun a b : Z => Zis_gcd a b 1 : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments rel_prime (_ _)%Z_scope
N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
prop1 : forall m n : Z, rel_prime m n -> distinct_parity m n -> rel_prime (m + n) (n - m)
prop2 : forall m n : Z, rel_prime m n -> rel_prime (m * m) (n * n)
prop2b : forall m n : Z, rel_prime m n -> rel_prime m (m * m + n * n)
relp_neq : forall m n : Z, m <> 1 -> m <> -1 -> rel_prime m n -> m <> n
relp_sum : forall m n : Z, rel_prime (m + n) (m - n) -> rel_prime m n
prime_dec_aux : forall p m : Z, {forall n : Z, 1 < n < m -> rel_prime n p} + {exists n : Z, 1 < n < m /\ ~ rel_prime n p}
Z.divide_antisym : forall n m : Z, (n | m) -> (m | n) -> n = m \/ n = - m
Zne_left : forall n m : Z, Zne n m -> Zne (n + - m) 0
Z.divide_mul_l : forall n m p : Z, (n | m) -> (n | m * p)
Z.mul_opp_r : forall n m : Z, n * - m = - (n * m)
Z.lt_gt : forall n m : Z, n < m -> m > n
Z.lt_le_incl : forall n m : Z, n < m -> n <= m
Z.gt_lt : forall n m : Z, n > m -> m < n
Z.ge_le : forall n m : Z, n >= m -> m <= n
Z.divide_add_r : forall n m p : Z, (n | m) -> (n | p) -> (n | m + p)
Z.divide_sub_r : forall n m p : Z, (n | m) -> (n | p) -> (n | m - p)
Znot_lt_ge : forall n m : Z, ~ n < m -> n >= m
Zlt_le_succ : forall n m : Z, n < m -> Z.succ n <= m
Zle_not_lt : forall n m : Z, n <= m -> ~ m < n
Zgt_asym : forall n m : Z, n > m -> ~ m > n
Z.lt_lt_succ_r : forall n m : Z, n < m -> n < Z.succ m
Znot_le_gt : forall n m : Z, ~ n <= m -> n > m
Znot_gt_le : forall n m : Z, ~ n > m -> n <= m
Zlt_succ_le : forall n m : Z, n < Z.succ m -> n <= m
Z.divide_factor_l : forall n m : Z, (n | n * m)
Z.le_trans : forall n m p : Z, n <= m -> m <= p -> n <= p
Z.lt_trans : forall n m p : Z, n < m -> m < p -> n < p
Zge_left : forall n m : Z, n >= m -> 0 <= n + - m
Zle_left : forall n m : Z, n <= m -> 0 <= m + - n
Zegal_left : forall n m : Z, n = m -> n + - m = 0

```coq
intros m n.
intro Hrel_prime.
unfold rel_prime in Hrel_prime.
rewrite Zis_gcd.comm in Hrel_prime.
rewrite Zis_gcd.mult_l in Hrel_prime.
rewrite Zis_gcd.mult_r in Hrel_prime.
rewrite Zis_gcd.add_l in Hrel_prime.
rewrite Zis_gcd.add_r in Hrel_prime.
apply prop2b.
apply Hrel_prime.
Qed.

original: intros m n. intro Hrel_prime. unfold rel_prime in Hrel_prime. rewrite Zis_gcd.comm in Hrel_prime. rewrite Zis_gcd.mult_l in Hrel_prime. rewrite Zis_gcd.mult_r in Hrel_prime. rewrite Zis_gcd.add_l in Hrel_prime. rewrite Zis_gcd.add_r in Hrel_prime. apply prop2b. apply Hrel_prime.
